tool.name: SDF sort and filter
tool.description: using the sdsort provided with rxDock

param.name: top
param.label: Number of records to keep in output
param.help: Number of best scoring records to keep

param.name: sort_field
param.label: Field to sort on
param.help: Name of the field to sort records by

param.name: name_field
param.label: Grouping field name
param.help: Name of the field to group records by (must be sequential)

param.name: descending
param.label: Sort descending
param.help: Generate the name field (first line) for cases where this is empty

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
This tool sorts and filters SD files using the sdsort and sdfilter tools from the rxDock suite. See https://www.rxdock.org for more details about rxDock and associated programs. The expected use is for filtering and sorting virtual screening results such as docking.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs** An SD-file, together with names of fields to sort and group records by, and the number of records to appear in the output. The sorting is performed on groups of molecules, with the group being identified by a field in the SDF (the name_field parameter). Records from a group MUST be sequential. The records within each group are sorted by the value of a field in the SDF (the sort_field parameter) and you can specify ascending or descending order (the descending parameter). Finally a number of top scoring (the top parameter, typically having a value of 1) are written to the output.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs** An SD-file, containing molecules filtered by the field specified.
